text: Hi everyone. I built a simple workflow with a webhook that enrolls contacts created before a certain date. I de-activated the re-enrollment, yet I still keep seeing HubSpot POST enrolment request to my webhook URL for the same contacts regularly every 10 or 15 minutes. Does anyone know what causes this automatic re-enrollment behaviour, and where I can be de-activated once and for all? Thanks in advance.

Sounds like this could be the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows|retry behavior described here>:
>  *Please note:* HubSpot will retry failed webhooks for up to three days, starting one minute after failure. Subsequent failures will be retried at increasing intervals, with a maximum gap of eight hours between tries. Learn about specific error code exceptions in <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/webhook_information|HubSpot's developer documentation>.
Is the webhook issuing a 2XX response?

> Does anyone know what causes this automatic re-enrollment behaviour, and where I can be de-activated once and for all?
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/turn-off-workflows|Turning off the workflow> might let the already-enrolled contacts clear.
Hey! Anyone knows how to *add validation to mobile phone number?*
